articles.headline: Losses in Pakistani Haven Strain Afghan Taliban
articles.snippet: Killings, arrests and internal disputes have reached the Afghan Taliban even in their haven in Pakistan, security officials say.
articles.abstract: Killings, arrests and internal disputes have reached the Afghan Taliban even in their haven in Pakistan, security officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — The Afghan Taliban are showing signs of increasing strain after a number of killings, arrests and internal disputes that have reached them even in their haven in Pakistan, Afghan security officials and Afghans with contacts in the Taliban say.

articles.headline: Report Criticizes High Pay at Fannie and Freddie
articles.snippet: Regulators have approved generous executive compensation at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the taxpayer-backed mortgage finance giants, with little scrutiny, a report found.
articles.abstract: Regulators have approved generous executive compensation at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the taxpayer-backed mortgage finance giants, with little scrutiny, a report found.
articles.lead_paragraph: Regulators have approved generous executive compensation at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the taxpayer-backed mortgage finance giants, with little scrutiny or analysis, according to a report published Thursday by the inspector general of the Federal Housing Finance Agency.

articles.headline: Many Low-Wage Jobs Seen as Failing to Meet Basic Needs
articles.snippet: A study shows how much income it takes to ensure economic security without relying on public subsidies.
articles.abstract: A study shows how much income it takes to ensure economic security without relying on public subsidies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hard as it can be to land a job these days, getting one may not be nearly enough for basic economic security.

articles.headline: Even Funds That Lagged Paid Richly
articles.snippet: John Paulson earned a record $4.9 billion in 2010 after a wager on gold. Other managers reaped big paychecks as their funds earned single-digit returns.
articles.abstract: John Paulson earned a record $4.9 billion in 2010 after a wager on gold. Other managers reaped big paychecks as their funds earned single-digit returns.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ten years ago, when the hedge fund industry was much smaller than it is today, it took 25 hedge fund managers to earn a combined annual payday of $5 billion.

articles.headline: Afghans Avenge Florida Koran Burning, Killing 12
articles.snippet: Thousands of protesters overran the United Nations compound in Mazar-i-Sharif, killing at least 12 people, Afghan and United Nations officials said.
articles.abstract: Thousands of protesters overran the United Nations compound in Mazar-i-Sharif, killing at least 12 people, Afghan and United Nations officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAZAR-I-SHARIF, Afghanistan — Stirred up by three angry mullahs who urged them to avenge the burning of a Koran at a Florida church, thousands of protesters on Friday overran the compound of the United Nations in this northern Afghan city, killing at least 12 people, Afghan and United Nations officials said.
articles.byline: By Enayat Najafizada and Rod Nordland

articles.headline: Job Growth Suggests Resilience of U.S. Recovery
articles.snippet: The United States economy added 216,000 jobs in March, the Labor Department said, and the unemployment rate fell another jot, to 8.8 percent.
articles.abstract: The United States economy added 216,000 jobs in March, the Labor Department said, and the unemployment rate fell another jot, to 8.8 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States economy showed signs of kicking into gear in March, adding 216,000 jobs and prompting President Obama to proclaim a corner finally turned.
